FHIR.name: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources
FHIR.description: A standard describing data formats and elements and an application programming interface for exchanging electronic health records

HL7.name: Health Level Seven International
HL7.description: A set of international standards for transfer of clinical and administrative data between software applications used by various healthcare providers

HL7 FHIR.name: HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources
HL7 FHIR.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, a modern standard for exchanging healthcare information electronically

SNOMED.name: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
SNOMED.description: A systematically organized computer processable collection of medical terms providing codes, terms, synonyms and definitions used in clinical documentation and reporting

ICD.name: International Classification of Diseases
ICD.description: The standard diagnostic tool for epidemiology, health management and clinical purposes maintained by the World Health Organization

LOINC.name: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes
LOINC.description: A database and universal standard for identifying medical laboratory observations

DICOM.name: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DICOM.description: The standard for the communication and management of medical imaging information and related data

GS1.name: GS1 Global Standards
GS1.description: Global Standards One, an international standard for supply chain management and product identification in healthcare

REST.name: Representational State Transfer
REST.description: An architectural style for designing networked applications, particularly web services

SOAP.name: Simple Object Access Protocol
SOAP.description: A messaging protocol specification for exchanging structured information in web services

JSON.name: JavaScript Object Notation
JSON.description: A lightweight data-interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write

XML.name: eXtensible Markup Language
XML.description: A markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable

OAuth.name: Open Authorization
OAuth.description: An open standard for access delegation, commonly used for token-based authentication and authorization

OpenAPI.name: OpenAPI Specification
OpenAPI.description: A specification for building APIs, formerly known as Swagger

ADX.name: Aggregate Data Exchange
ADX.description: Aggregate Data Exchange standard for exchanging aggregate health data, commonly used in public health reporting and statistical analysis
